page.title: 04VILLAGE,DUNTISBOURNE LEER
page.content: Duntisbourne Leer,which means a valley bottom amongst hills,is a small picturesque village about 4 miles from Cirencester.For record purposes it is joined to D.Abbots.Many of the properties are detached cottages, although there are farms around, and some have dovecotes built into the eaves.In recent years some building has been permitted and it is hoped by villagers that future development except for renovation would be refused.The ford and its family of ducks are quite a tourist attraction as are the cottages ,all with an abundance of flowers,around this area. Life is very quiet and slow-moving although the peace is periodically disturbed by aircraft flying overhead. Leer is a village with fewer facilities than in the past but which still delights its residents.
